memory.title: GitHub push blocked by Discord bot tokens in commit history
memory.content: GitHub secret scanning blocked pushes due to Discord bot tokens committed in old history (discord-listener.ts and server.ts). Two options: (1) visit the unblock URL GitHub provides to allow the push, or (2) scrub history with git filter-repo + force-push. The unblock URL is faster but the tokens remain in history. For production, scrub the history.
memory.rule: Never commit API tokens or bot tokens to source files. Use environment variables. If already committed, scrub with git filter-repo.

memory.title: Used hw_quick_insights to bypass full deliberation guardrails on a real decision
memory.content: Ran quick insights on "system explorer layout" which was clearly a design decision. All agents converged in 2 rounds with no tension. Then listed the missing guardrails as "unsolved problems" when they were already built. Root cause: context compaction lost working knowledge of deliberation system. Fix applied: hw_quick_insights now blocks decision-like topics with pattern matching and redirects to hw_plan_deliberation.
memory.rule: If agents will deliberate something that changes code, architecture, layout, or strategy, ALWAYS use hw_plan_deliberation with sub-questions. hw_quick_insights is ONLY for vague exploration with no action planned. The tool now enforces this in code.

memory.title: Method: 6-agent parallel research sprint
memory.content: Spawn 6 agents simultaneously, each researching a different angle of the same question. Agents cover: direct competitors, adjacent competitors, academic state of the art, practitioner experience, simple approaches that work, and failure modes/anti-patterns. Results come back in ~3-4 minutes. Synthesis happens in the main thread. Used multiple times: S53 memory systems research, earlier competitive intel runs. Use Sonnet 4.6 1M for research agents to save cost.
memory.rule: When researching a domain, always cover at least these 6 angles: competitors, academia, practitioners, simple baselines, and anti-patterns. Use Sonnet for research agents.
